Pennsylvania Attorney General & Gubernatorial Candidate, josh Shapiro (D. PA)
Heres some more good news today out of Pennsylvania:
Though the candidates in the GOPs vast primary field had sizable fundraising hauls by conventional standards, it was the lone Democratic contender for Pennsylvania governor  Attorney General Josh Shapiro  who nearly out-raised them by himself and ended the last fundraising period with a staggering amount of money on hand.

The four Republican frontrunners whove registered at more than 10% in recent polling  former U.S. attorney Bill McSwain, State Sen. Doug Mastriano, former U.S. Rep. Lou Barletta and businessman Dave White  brought in a combined $4.62 million from Jan. 1 to March 28, according to new campaign finance filings.

Call it the consequences of a crowded field for the GOP, or consider it a testament to Mr. Shapiros strength as a candidate; neither change the fact that Democrats can gear up to run one of the most well-funded campaigns in state history in their effort to hold onto the governors mansion this November.

Heres the latest on the GOP Primary:
A new WKBN/Emerson College Polling/The Hill Pennsylvania primary poll shows Lou Barletta with a razor-thin lead over Doug Mastriano in the race for Governor and a majority of voters still undecided.

Click below to donate and get involved with Shapiro, Fetterman and these Pennsylvania Democrats campaigns:

Former U.S. Attorney William McSwain finished fourth with 7.9% and President Pro Tempore of Pennsylvanias Senate Jake Corman received 4%.
Yep, the leading GOP contenders are Trumps Political Godfather, Lou Barletta, and Insurrectionist, Doug Mastriano.
Barletta, a former congressman and Mayor of Hazelton, received 19.8% support among 1,000 likely Republican voters.
State Senator Mastriano finished a close second with 19.4%, followed by businessman Dave White at 11.6%.
Health and Democracy are on the ballot this year and we need to get ready to keep Pennsylvania Blue.
Melissa Hart and Charles Gerow each received 3.1%, Joseph Gale had 2.9%, and Nche Zama had 1.7%.
Thats more than four times the amount of every dollar in the four GOP frontrunners coffers.
Look no further than the total amount Mr. Shapiro carried into April: $16 million.
Mr. Shapiros haul, meanwhile, checked in at $4.53 million.
